name: Rainforest Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rainforest retreat is a great place to experience a unique kind of stay in NZ - at a rainforest retreat. The retreat is big and has tree houses, tree huts, motel style rooms, dormitories, caravan parks and standalone houses. There's room for everybody, the backpacker, the family, the couple and the gangs.
reviews.title: One size fits all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The retreat is off the main road but only 5 mins away from the town centre and offices of other attractions such as glacier guides. They had a common kitchen for all guests to use and a laundromat with several machines and dryers.
reviews.title: Didn't like it

reviews.text: We stayed at the tree hut which was a 1 room with ensuite bathroom hut made out of wood sitting on stilts. The room was spacious, had a queen size bed and a single bed, with tea/coffee machine and other amenities. The bathroom had a standing shower. The room was clean and tidy and gave a nice feeling. The temperature was superb, being within the confines of rainforest it was raining most of the time with temperatures hovering around 18 degrees.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I hadn't searched for many options in FJ as I was keen to stay at this location, so I won't be able to compare this place with others, but on an absolute basis, Rainforest retreat gives a pleasant feeling during your stay. I would not recommend staying here in case you are looking for 5 star stuff.
reviews.title: Pleasant, quiet stay in the trees

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative is that the retreat is filled with gravel and pebbles (there is no paved road) and hence rolling suitcases is very difficult.
reviews.title: Nice, room, staff, position...caters for a big range of clientele

reviews.text: Stayed in the tree house. The family loved it. Excellent house on secluded part of the site, surrounded by trees. Spacious property with all mod-cons. Site is close to centre of Frans Josef. On-site pub/restaurant provided good value food and drink.
reviews.title: Excellent property in secluded location

reviews.text: I booked a tree house and it was more like a log house in a bit of native bush. Definitely not a tree house and very basic facilities for the price. We had much better 2 bedroom accommodation In queenstown for the same price.
reviews.title: Doesn't live up to description

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Rainforest Retreat for 2 nights in November 2010, while we were in town for the Glacier climb. We had a motel unit (there are hostel and lodge rooms available). Although the room was fine, it was the smallest of all the motel rooms we stayed in on our trip. The location was good, just a few minutes walk from the shops and Glacier Hike centre. The room was clean. There was a small fridge, but no hob or microwave. You used the bathroom sink to fill the kettle, though the sink was a bit small for the job really! The shower was OK. The TV signal was good, and there was a DVD player. The bed was comfortable. We got extra pillows and a hairdryer from reception. There was cheap internet access at reception, and the onsite bar / restaurant was good (especially during happy hour!).
reviews.title: Not bad for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights while I was in Franz Josef. We stayed in a Tree Lodge & it was lovely! Large and spacious for 2 people with nice modern fixture & fittings. It was also quiet secluded and private which I liked, but at the same time very close to town. We also had a balcony where you could have breakfast.
reviews.title: Loved this place...... Luxury Tree House!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Glacier Hot Pools are just across the road, so very handy. We didn't eat in the restaurant but had a few drinks in the bar and it was very lively and good fun!
reviews.title: Great place to stay in frans joseph

reviews.text: Rain Forest Retreat is basic style accommodation. Not bad, pretty decent, great location but not brilliant. Just little things in terms of ageing mattresses, basic linen and cheaper cuts of meat in the food.
reviews.title: Good Accommodation. But not really a family venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Point of note: Because the various budget/younger tour companies often stop here, with the bar party central, its probably not the most family friendly venue. A few people in various state of dress, some wild drinking and the ever familiar stagger through the car park are ever present.
reviews.title: Perfect ending to a great trip
Pleasant and cosy
reviews.text: Still its a great location, looks funky from the outside, very nice staff and a decent price still makes me recommend it. Just needs to improve slightly on the bedding.

reviews.title: Fantastic place
reviews.text: This resort was a welcome change after being surrounded by lakes for 2 weeks. We stayed in a studio tree lodge & were lucky to get the one right at the end of the resort. There is an outdoor seating & the glass door & bay window ensure that all one can see is thick rainforest and the only sound one hears is that of an occasional bird/insect/wildlife or raindrops falling on the leaves. A small patch in the cieling is made of glass, so you get a glimpse of the rainforest till the last ray of sun goes down.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped here in a studio motel room. Very pleasant rooms and very cosy. Nothing to complain about!
reviews.title: Quiet and very warm

reviews.text: I have stayed in the Rainforest Retreat about 3 times now, on both Business and Leisure and recommend it to friends and family all the time. Love the place. In terms of backpacking, the hostel is run by people who know how to efficiently run a backpacker hostel and warn all the guests to keep the noise down when returning from the bar/restaurant because there are guests in rooms who value their sleep. When staying in the motel rooms they have always been clean and ready for me when I get there. Some of the dorm rooms have lovely new mattresses which is great as a backpacker. When staying in the more upmarket rooms they've never failed me.
reviews.title: Will Stay Again and Again!

reviews.text: It's a very spread out set up in the rain forest, it's absolutely beautiful!
reviews.title: great place to stay in Franz

reviews.text: Some other reviews have commented on how they were treated like a bunch of drunken students, if they knew the rules they would know to keep the drinking under raps!!!!!
reviews.title: Loved it - nice room ... close to glaciers ... close to hot pools

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The accommodation is a licensed premises which means you are not supposed to drink at all under New Zealand law!! So they were doing them a favor by turning a blind eye. Yes there are wine glasses in some of the rooms, this is the more expensive rooms so they assume you are going to have a quite responsible wine....
reviews.title: Very Basic and Overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the restaurant, delicious! They are currently refurbing the place. Should look great when it's finished.
reviews.title: Waking up in the forest canopy makes for a unique experience

description: Rainforest Retreat is centrally located in the heart of Franz Josef Glacier township on the west coast of NZ’s South Island.Nestled in six acres of native bush and surrounded by lush punga groves, Rainforest Retreat offers a wide range of accommodation – all built to embrace the natural environment.Whatever the season, explore New Zealand’s glaciers while staying at Rainforest Retreat. It’s not just accommodation… it’s an experience!
